svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
April 29, 2023" date: "2023-04-29"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko . Notes
from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Cancun upgrade to include: EIP4844
(protodankscaling), EIP6780 (SELFDESTRUCT only in same tx), EIP1153 (transient
storage) & EIP6475 (SSZ optional type) Cancun may potentially include: EIP4788 (beacon
block root in EVM), EIP6493 (SSZ tx signature scheme) & EIP2537 (BLS precompile) EOF
not in Cancun, discussed making main feature of future upgrade
Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko . Notes
from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim :
* Cancun upgrade to include: EIP4844 (protodankscaling), EIP6780 (SELFDESTRUCT only in
same tx), EIP1153 (transient storage) & EIP6475 (SSZ optional type)
Cancun upgrade to include: EIP4844 (protodankscaling), EIP6780 (SELFDESTRUCT only in
* Cancun may potentially include: EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM), EIP6493 (SSZ tx
signature scheme) & EIP2537 (BLS precompile)
Cancun may potentially include: EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM), EIP6493 (SSZ tx
* EOF not in Cancun, discussed making main feature of future upgrade
EOF not in Cancun, discussed making main feature of future upgrade
* EIP4844 devnet 5 successfully launched
EIP4844 devnet 5 successfully launched
* KZG Ceremony : 91,000+ contributions, contribute with an account nonce of 64
KZG Ceremony : 91,000+ contributions, contribute with an account nonce of 64
Layer 1
* MEV-Boost relay vulnerability disclosed , block equivocation strategy with early
getPayload calls
MEV-Boost relay vulnerability disclosed , block equivocation strategy with early
* Rinkeby testnet Q2/Q3 shutdown proposed for June 1
Rinkeby testnet Q2/Q3 shutdown proposed for June 1
* Geth removing Clique & PoW support
Geth removing Clique & PoW support
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Nimbus v23.4.0 : fixes missed proposals (low probability) Teku
v23.4.0 : fix for slow block processing with multiple voluntary exits
Consensus layer:
* Nimbus v23.4.0 : fixes missed proposals (low probability)
Nimbus v23.4.0 : fixes missed proposals (low probability)
* Teku v23.4.0 : fix for slow block processing with multiple voluntary exits
Teku v23.4.0 : fix for slow block processing with multiple voluntary exits
* Execution layer: Erigon v2.43.0 : adds Caplin phase 1 (embedded Consensus Layer);
diagnostics web app
Execution layer:
* Erigon v2.43.0 : adds Caplin phase 1 (embedded Consensus Layer); diagnostics web app
Research
* MEV-Boost & fork choice rule : impact of latency on consensus
MEV-Boost & fork choice rule : impact of latency on consensus
* Overview of dankscaling : proposal to use 25% of samples for reconstruction
Overview of dankscaling : proposal to use 25% of samples for reconstruction
* Post quantum stealth addresses using Commutative Supersingular isogenies (CSIDH)
Post quantum stealth addresses using Commutative Supersingular isogenies (CSIDH)
* Confirmation rule : typically under 1 minute, weaker guarantee than finality
Confirmation rule : typically under 1 minute, weaker guarantee than finality
Layer 2
* Proposal for cross layer communication using a precompile to read the Layer 1 state
root
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP6953 : Network upgrade activation triggers
EIPs:
* EIP6953 : Network upgrade activation triggers
* ERCs: ERC6927 : NFT fusing protocol ERC6932 : Subscription-based token ERC6944 :
ERC5219 resolve mode
ERCs:
* ERC6927 : NFT fusing protocol
ERC6927 : NFT fusing protocol
* ERC6932 : Subscription-based token
ERC6932 : Subscription-based token
* ERC6944 : ERC5219 resolve mode
ERC6944 : ERC5219 resolve mode
This newsletter is made possible thanks to the funding received from Optimism’s
RetroPGF !
Thank you to Optimism’s RetroPGF round 2 which generously funded Week in Ethereum News
for “months, not weeks.”
Stuff for developers
* Foundry Forge-std v1.5.4 : adds set breakpoint cheat and count overload to
expectCall cheat
Foundry Forge-std v1.5.4 : adds set breakpoint cheat and count overload to expectCall
cheat
* Forge-deploy : track deployments by name and reuse in Solidity
Forge-deploy : track deployments by name and reuse in Solidity
* Solc-ast-rs : Rust bindings for Solidity AST & visitors
Solc-ast-rs : Rust bindings for Solidity AST & visitors
* Slitherin : custom Slither detectors with higher sensitivity but higher false
positives
Slitherin : custom Slither detectors with higher sensitivity but higher false
* Equivalence checker : compare code in Yul/assembly, Solidity or Certora Verification
Language
Equivalence checker : compare code in Yul/assembly, Solidity or Certora Verification
* Contract Fiesta : dataset of source code for 150k unique contracts
Contract Fiesta : dataset of source code for 150k unique contracts
* Safe: ERC2535 (Diamond proxy) unsuitable for smart accounts (account abstraction)
Safe: ERC2535 (Diamond proxy) unsuitable for smart accounts (account abstraction)
* Governance proposal simulation framework : catch incorrectly linked contracts,
invalid state transitions, broken dependencies and logic errors
Governance proposal simulation framework : catch incorrectly linked contracts, invalid
state transitions, broken dependencies and logic errors
* Curta CTF Groovy Fruit Fiesta solution
Curta CTF Groovy Fruit Fiesta solution
* All Wallet Devs call video and notes
All Wallet Devs call video and notes
* Zokrates v0.8.7 : Nova experimental support
Zokrates v0.8.7 : Nova experimental support
* zkLLVM & Proof Market : guide to integrating zk proofs
zkLLVM & Proof Market : guide to integrating zk proofs
Security
* Mysterious wallet drainer (described by Taylor last week): victims encouraged to
come forward
Mysterious wallet drainer (described by Taylor last week): victims encouraged to come
forward
* Merlin DEX on zkSync $1.8 million stolen , devs had unlimited approval
Merlin DEX on zkSync $1.8 million stolen , devs had unlimited approval
* Blur NFT marketplace canceled bids were accepted
Blur NFT marketplace canceled bids were accepted
* Trust wallet browser extension vulnerability disclosed , mnemonics could be found by
brute force, $100k bounty paid
Trust wallet browser extension vulnerability disclosed , mnemonics could be found by
* Profanity Brute-force : reconstruct a private key generated using Profanity
Profanity Brute-force : reconstruct a private key generated using Profanity
Ecosystem
* Staking deposit queue flipped exit queue
Notable at app layer
* ENS manager app v3 and ENS Name Wrapper live
ENS manager app v3 and ENS Name Wrapper live
* Gitcoin Passport Unique Humanity Score of 15 needed for Gitcoin Grants Beta Round
matching
Gitcoin Passport Unique Humanity Score of 15 needed for Gitcoin Grants Beta Round
* Stelo Explore : universal contract interface
Stelo Explore : universal contract interface
* Eric Wall’s Orb NFT: holder can ask Eric a question a week, 300% Harberger tax
Eric Wall’s Orb NFT: holder can ask Eric a question a week, 300% Harberger tax
Job Listings
* Snr React Native UI Dev at Status: All jobs
Snr React Native UI Dev at Status: All jobs
* Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
* Mimic seek a blockchain engineer
Mimic seek a blockchain engineer
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable to abcoathup.eth.
Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* Professor Gary Gensler in 2018 MIT course: “ 3/4 of the market is non-securities “
Professor Gary Gensler in 2018 MIT course: “ 3/4 of the market is non-securities “
* Binance US terminated $1 billion purchase deal of Voyager assets
Binance US terminated $1 billion purchase deal of Voyager assets
* UK tax proposal to not treat DeFi transactions as disposals
UK tax proposal to not treat DeFi transactions as disposals
* Paul Brody: enjoy the final Crypto Winter
Paul Brody: enjoy the final Crypto Winter
General/crypto
* TxRank : transaction anomaly detection tool using a Large Language Model
TxRank : transaction anomaly detection tool using a Large Language Model
* HyperNova : recursive arguments for customizable constraint systems
HyperNova : recursive arguments for customizable constraint systems
* Zator : verified inference of a 512-layer neural network using recursive SNARKs
Zator : verified inference of a 512-layer neural network using recursive SNARKs
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-april-29-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* May 5-10 – ETHTallinn hackathon & NFT Tallinn conference
May 5-10 – ETHTallinn hackathon & NFT Tallinn conference
* May 9 – Gitcoin Grants Beta Round ends (support Week in Eth News )
May 9 – Gitcoin Grants Beta Round ends (support Week in Eth News )
* May 9-12 – EY blockchain summit
May 9-12 – EY blockchain summit
* May 11-14 – Pragma Lisbon & ETHGlobal Lisbon hackathon
May 11-14 – Pragma Lisbon & ETHGlobal Lisbon hackathon
* May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)
May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)
* May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
* May 24-26 – Spaghett ETH (Naples) conference
May 24-26 – Spaghett ETH (Naples) conference
* May 26-28 – ETHDublin hackathon
May 26-28 – ETHDublin hackathon
* Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
* Jun 2-7 – ETH Belgrade conference & hackathon
Jun 2-7 – ETH Belgrade conference & hackathon
* Jun 9-11 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
Jun 9-11 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
* Jun 23–25 – ETHGlobal Waterloo (changed from Toronto)
Jun 23–25 – ETHGlobal Waterloo (changed from Toronto)
* Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona
Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona
* Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
* Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
* Aug 13-16 – ETHToronto & ETHWomen
Aug 13-16 – ETHToronto & ETHWomen
* Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
* Aug 28-30 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
Aug 28-30 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
* Aug 30 – Sep 3 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
Aug 30 – Sep 3 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
* Sep 1-3 – Ethcon Korea hackathon
Sep 1-3 – Ethcon Korea hackathon
* Sep 10-12 – Ethereum Singapore hackathon & conference
Sep 10-12 – Ethereum Singapore hackathon & conference
* Sep 11-13 – DappCon (Berlin)
Sep 11-13 – DappCon (Berlin)
* Sep 15 – Protocol Berg (Berlin)
Sep 15 – Protocol Berg (Berlin)
* Sep 18-21 – ETH Montréal hackathon & conference
Sep 18-21 – ETH Montréal hackathon & conference
* Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
* Oct 5-6 – ETHMilan conference
Oct 5-6 – ETHMilan conference
* Oct 6–27 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
Oct 6–27 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
* Oct 27–29 – ETH Miami festival + hackathon
Oct 27–29 – ETH Miami festival + hackathon
* Oct 28–30 – ETH Lisbon hackathon
Oct 28–30 – ETH Lisbon hackathon
* Nov 13-19 – Devconnect (Istanbul)
Nov 13-19 – Devconnect (Istanbul)
* Nov 17-19 – ETHGlobal Istanbul
Nov 17-19 – ETHGlobal Istanbul
